title: [Large-Scale] Critical Reading Skill Development Process via Strengthening Critical Thinking Dispositions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic reading comprehension skills and experience in academic or professional reading contexts
context.additional_context: A short-term course to enhance critical thinking and reading skills needed for analyzing/evaluating social domain texts encountered by working professionals

learning_goals: Learners can explain reading strategies applying the seven critical thinking dispositions (truth-seeking, open-mindedness, analyticity, systematicity, confidence in reasoning, judgment, and inquisitiveness) when analyzing diverse social studies texts
Critical reading abilities (evaluation and analysis) can be improved by 20% or more through explicit instruction-based activities
Learners can write self-reflection reports based on critical reading performance results from digital device-based formative assessments

resources: California Critical Thinking Disposition Inventory (CCTDI)-Based Survey Tool
Social Studies Sample Texts (News Articles, Policy Documents, etc.)
Digital Learning Management System (LMS) Access Permissions
Self-Assessment Rubric for Critical Reading Assessment (CRCT)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
